reviews.review_text: The katsu is definitely worth the hype, the crust is incredibly flaky and fresh without being overly oily, and the meat was juicy and soft. The house made sesame sauce is to die for and the unlimited cabbage salad makes for a good delivery vehicle of said sauce. Beautiful ambience, almost fine dining-like. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

I had a really nice expirence at this location,we were greeted nicely at the door and got a table really fast even without a reservation,service was really good and very helpful. Food was delicious and the option of refilling the soup and the cabbage  anytime was also very generous and well appreciated,presentation of the food is also great and we really enjoyed the vibe of the restaurant,its very photogenic. Another good place in Vancouver

Came here for brunch and the wait to get a table for 4 was honestly not too bad (~15 mins). If everyone at the table gets a dish worth $9 or more then you get unlimited rice, miso soup, and salad. Which is great because their salad is so good as is their dressing and really gives your palate a break/reset from the deep fried foods that is your main meal. We got a side of curry because katsu and curry is just a perfect combination and if youve never poured curry over your katsu before, definitely recommend it!

One of the best restaurants I ve ever been to in my entire life. The food was phenomenal, presented beautifully, and the service was efficient and attentive. Each person gets 1 free miso and 1 free rice refill (meaning each person gets 2 misos and 2 rice bowls in total, at least when we were there). The food was so fresh, tasted delicious, and I don t think we had to wait too like despite it being quite busy. We ordered 1 rosu katsu ($25), 1 rosu curry ($28), and 2 cheese katsus ($26.50 for one order). Although this place is quite pricey, it s worth it for the experience and the quality and amount of food. The cheese katsu is quite rich, the rosu curry is quite flavourful, and the breading of all of the katsus were amazing! We highly recommend coming here, but DON T FORGET TO MAKE A RESERVATION/BE PUT ON THE WAITING LIST ONLINE, because it s super busy once it opens, and you ll have to wait 30+ minutes if you don t have one. Vegetarian options: Variety of food options Kid-friendliness: Lots of food options and kids can share the big portions

Place can get busy so be prepared to wait on busy hours and dates.  Food here are pretty much top notch when it comes to Japanese Katsu.  Service is also exceptional, living up to Japanese high standard.  Food wait time is not too long but not too short either.  I am sure I will come back to this place for more. Also to mention, cabbage salad and miso soup refills are free of charge.  That is big  good  point extra.

Best cheese katsu and the decor is so classy and spacious. Def expect a wait, but you can line up on their virtual wait list and roam around while waiting. Free refills on the cabbage salad, rice and soup but the portions are pretty decent already

First of all, among all the restaurants Ive been to, this one can proudly claim to be the most courteous. Furthermore, I can confidently say it was the tastiest tonkatsu Ive ever had. The reason is that Ive tried over a hundred tonkatsu places, both famous ones in Korea and Japan, but while 90% had similar flavors, none of them were 100% friendly. Thats because the best places are usually too busy to be friendly. However, here, every staff member was exceptionally friendly. Even though I used basic Japanese instead of English, they treated me with utmost kindness. Among them, a staff member with slightly dyed white hair was fluent in Korean and provided excellent service. As a result, Im leaving this comment now. Even when I asked for extra vegetables or miso soup, they gladly provided them without any sign of inconvenience. Every staff member was genuinely, truly friendly and provided top-notch service, which is why I plan to visit frequently. If youre planning a trip to Japan, I highly recommend going here. Its a definite pass for Vancouvers best restaurant!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Saku over exceeded my expectations. I ve had many katsu dishes in the past and the cheese katsu I got at Saku has to be one of the best I ve ever tried. I am also very pleasantly surprised that the cabbage, miso soup and rice are refillable - so my friend and I got one meal set and extra katsu on the side. The atmosphere of this restaurant is amazing. It is so aesthetically pleasing and the employees are very accommodating. I would definitely return when I m ever in Vancouver again. Thanks for the amazing meal and great service.

Delicious katsu. The curry and rice ratio was spot on. Everything was delicious. We entered ourselves on the waitlist and when we were called, they got our order as the table wasn t completely ready but the wait for our food was shorter because of it. Cheese katsu as a side was definitely worth it. With the amount of food and quality we got, it was definitely a bang for your buck. Would definitely come back here.

Will 100% be coming back when I visit Vancouver again!! Wow this place was fantastic and for the price?! It s so utterly worth visiting. The place was so busy but worth the 10ish minute wait I had. You walk in and are immediately presented with the aroma of the oil and breading (in a good way). They kindly explained how everything worked, what everything was and even left me be so I could FaceTime my partner and have a meal with him (he s staying home in Winnipeg) so I really appreciated that. The food was absolutely delicious, crispy coating, juicy pork and just overall amazing sides!!

The pork, chicken, shrimp katsu is very juicy and tender on the inside. The outside is crunchy and not oily. The sauce is great but sprinkling salt and sesame seems to bring out meat taste more. Do not recommend the white fish as it was slightly soggy at the bottom and the fish was quite tough in the middle. Other white fish I had before is very fluffy and light with a gentle sweetness to it. This one was briny only. Presentation of the food is great. Seating is wonderfully spacious. Service is quite attentive and friendly. All in all it was a very pleasant experience. Slightly on the expensive side. Kid-friendliness: High chairs and kids tableware

One of the best Katsu restaurants Ive ever been to, including restaurants in Japan. Generous portions and amazingly tasting food. Servers were polite and professional. We had a small wait after joining the waitlist and a server took our order to get the food started before we even sat down so I loved the efficiency.

I am absolutely smitten with the culinary delights offered at this remarkable Japanese restaurant. However, what truly sets it apart is the exceptional team of individuals who work here. The waitstaff exhibited unmatched friendliness, going above and beyond by attentively checking on my friend and me throughout the dining experience. Their genuine care and attentiveness truly left a lasting impression. Kudos to this establishment for fostering such a warm and caring environment!
the chicken thigh katsu curry and the miso katsu were so amazing and delicious. The service were on point, always ready to help you. Overall, I love this restaurant.

Beautiful restaurant and fresh delicious food! Came back after a couple years ago.. Questioning myself why I didnt come here more regularly.. Hotake was so fresh and melted in my mouth. Excellent service, friendly and attentive! Ill be back shortly!

Since I had the pork cutlet in Saku, I don t eat a pork cutlet anywhere else anymore. Whenever I had it other places, I was comparing it with Saku My favorite is Tokujyo Rosu katsu( premium cut) with is light, crispy, juicy and tender.  The kaki fry- oyster is very good too. The Udon was the best. They serve very good  the miso soup (ton jiru) and finely shredded cabbage with the house sesame sauce unlimited. Very good service and the airy Morden interior is plus. They are very popular. They don t take reservations. If you don t want to wait go odd hours or weekdays.

Very pleasant and friendly.  Food was fantastic. The chicken breast was prepared very well, hot and tasted fresh.    The soft drink was a bit of novelty but tasted good (strawberry).   The waiter we had was always smiling and very pleasant.  The place was quite as most patrons despite the place being full most of our visit spoke in low voices.

Saku exceeded all my expectations and more. It was so good!!! I had a lot of tonkatsu at popular places while working in Japan so I know what to compare to. I can say that Saku certainly deserves its fame! Its a delight to experience Japanese level of friendly service again. I will come back with an even bigger appetite!

I got the shrimp and scallop curry set and it was so good! The shrimp and scallop were both so plump and the whole set was yummy! Been here multiple times, the service is always attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is pretty and not too noisy.

reviews.reviewer_name: Jose Armando Targino Bezerra da Silva
reviews.review_text: Awesome food, great ambient, and good service. I ordered a Rosu Katsu set that comes with a lot of katsu options from their menu, and also the chicken curry katsu. Both dishes were really good. For the price you pay for the quality and amount of food, it turns out to be cheap for me. Definitely will be back.
Another recent WOW!  Best tonkutsu Ive ever had.  I tried the chicken breast katsu but the pork was amazing also.  Each item very well prepared, simply amazing.  Would definitely want to go back.

I don t even like katsu, but this food is amazing. I had the cheese katsu and hire katsu. like everyone else says, i could drink the sesame dressing. the rice, cabbage, and miso were perfect. don t tell my doctor i ate here; so much sodium

I ve never had a bad meal at SAKU, sometimes the issue is being able to get a table. My friend and I lined up just before dinner opening and were let in first (weekday evening). The amazing staff let us pick ANY table! The two of us sat in a large booth and felt very valued as customers. Very clean location, cute interior designs, and helpful friendly staff. I ve been ordering the Ebi Hotate Katsu lately, deep fried breaded jumbo prawn and scallops  never disappointed. The salad dressing is AMAZING and the miso is yum too. Both unlimited?! THE BEST! I love coming to SAKU when I m starving, it s so satisfying. Nom nom for us!!

My husband and I ordered the zenbu katsu and added an extra set of rice, salad and soup (which have unlimited refills btw). This is the way to do it. Even this was way too much food for the two of us and we ended up taking part of it home. We did get a side of curry and 1 deep fried oyster. Loved the oyster; could have done without the curry as it was literally just sauce, and very underwhelming sauce at that. I hear they get their crumbs from Cobs Bread, which would explain why the breading was so delicious. I look forward to going again.

I was a bit concerned that Saku would be all atmosphere and disappoint with the food. That was not the case. As well as an aesthetic and cozy setting, the Katsu curry we ordered was excellent. Service was accommodating and kind as well. I ordered the pork cutlet, as that was the specialty, however we preferred the chicken. My only constructive criticism is it would have been nice to have been served the miso & cabbage to enjoy before the katsu. Beyond that, well worth the visit.

Delicious tonkatsu! The seating is first come first serve - we waited about 25 mins on a Friday night. Portions are generous and you can get more rice, cabbage and miso soup on request. Tonkatsu is crispy and not dry at all. Highly recommend!

Very nice tonkatsu place. The coating is crispy and the chicken and pork are juicy and tender. We got the zenbutsu katsu, which basically means everything, and the portion was so huge that we couldnt finish it. The food tasted good though. Food

This place is always super busy with long line ups but with good reason. First off, the aesthetics of this place is exquisite.. I love the Japandi style. I thought the price was a little expensive but understandable when I saw the size of the portions. The presentation of the food was beautiful and delicious. I shared a Zenbu Katsu and this can definitely feed three mildly hungry people. Everything was crisp, not greasy and moist on the inside. The curry from their curry katsu was delicious too. Their staff were also nice and very attentive. This is a definite must-try place if youre in the area... Just make sure to put your name in the yelp waitlist in advance if you are planning to go so you dont have to wait too long.

Try their famous katsu its certainly an experience! This place is so popular you often have to wait in line to get seated. The katsu is authentic and extremely delicious. When you order a set, you get a good amount of meat and UNLIMITED refills of rice, miso, and salad. Thats a great deal if you ask me :)

This spot specializes in unforgettable Japanese pork cutlets & each dish leaves a lasting impression The katsu is lightly-battered & perfectly crispy & golden while the udon was super comforting & hearty     the best part is how every katsu set is served with unlimited rice, tonjiru and shredded cabbage They do get quite busy & don t take reservations so I def recommend joining their Yelp wait list ahead of time

We ordered a Rosu Katsu and a chicken thigh curry katsu. Both are delicious and juicy but I personally like the pork more. I love the design of the restaurant. Highly recommend this restaurant to anyone who loves deep fried pork cutlets! Will definitely come back again!

This was delicious and just a lovely experience. Its trendy but not obnoxious. I missed the text message to let me know it was my turn to be seated, and they called me 5 mins later and we were seated no problem. It was very relaxed and had a family friendly atmosphere. The food was perfect and a bit of an experience. They dont seem to just want to give you food in the trendy places, you have to prepare it at the table a bit yourself which is fun.
Very nice Japanese place. Excellent service. My niece brought an outside bubble tea drink and spilled it on the table, staff very patiently cleaned it up. Food was great.
I really like this service, very fast service and good staff. They monitor the cleanliness, after each client they wipe the table and chairs. Soup, rice and cabbage can be asked to be added.

Nice little quaint place. Staff were super friendly and service was fast. Free refills on the salad , rice, and soup though we didn t need it. Our water was always refilled and they did such a tremendous job while we dined there. Katsu was so juicy and tender! I love how they have the gravy baits too. I d highly recommend.
Awesome food, very nice staff, good portions and price. Been here a few times now and I have always enjoyed my meals. They specialize in authentic Japanese tonkatsu.

Simply amazing! A friend suggested we meet here I had no idea what to expect. The breaded and deep fried pork was amazing. I don t know how they get the consistency they do. Portion seemed a touch small so I added a cheese katsu add on which was delicious.

Amazing food, great service, beautiful interior. What else can you ask for? I especially love the unlimited salad/rice/miso, though the portion size is already great! Only wish there could be a bit more of the pickles. Would recommend the cheese katsu. The sesame dressing is really good! Will come again.

We ate so much that we had a food coma. Everything taste so good that we cannot stop eating. Services are very quick. Food is so so good. And greasy... but good. Only downside is the waiting time which can take hours.

Interior is spacious and very beautiful! A huge upgrade from the previous location. Zenbu Katsu is great if you have a big appetite and want to try everything. Comes with rosu, hire, chicken, cheese, ebi, hotate, and veggies. Food

Me and my friend ordered a rosu katsu set each. The food was filling and we enjoyed our lunch. Everything arrived hot. I particularly enjoyed the lemon salt that came (seperately) with the katsu, it was very unique. The service was really good as the servers explained to us how to eat and use each utensil and food as that was the first time we went. They also asked periodically how the food was and asked if we wanted a refill on the cabbage salad.
Delicious katsu and quick/friendly service. I got the curry, but the original sauce is also delicious. If I lived in the area, Id frequent this place.

Wow - hands down worth the wait! If you don t want to wait in line in person, download the Yelp app and wait virtually. They text you to tell you you re third in line if you re not already refreshing to check your spot, which is super convenient. Upon entering the restaurant, I found it to be super bright and clean with a beautiful open concept design and natural wood finishes and a touch of (fake?) plants. We were seated in a spacious booth with a QR code photo on the table as our menu. We ordered the hire and premium katsu, both which were tender and juicy with a super crispy crust! The set comes with rice, shredded cabbage (which tastes pretty delicious with the sesame dressing), miso soup, pickled veggies, sesame seeds with mortar and pestle for grinding and a a katsu sauce that reminds me of barbecue flavour. The set is beautifully displayed in a large wooden katsu tray making it look substantial and beautifully presented compared to other katsu places. The servers were constantly refilling our water and checking in; very attentive and I felt looked after. I also really liked the way our server explained that the premium pork might look pink inside but it s cooked and fine to eat. While I would ve eaten it anyway, it was a helpful and proactive reminder. Average price was $20-$23 per set but I would order and try the cheese katsu or even the larger zebu set next time (good for two people). I ll definitely be back!

Delicious food with beautiful presentation. The server could tell it was my first time and she asked when dropping the food. So she gave the run down on each dish as this is an immersive dining experience where you add your own salt, grind sesame seeds to add to a sauce and other garnishes and refillable sides. I loved it and loved the experience. It was quite bright inside otherwise loved the atmosphere. Being of North American heritage I wasnt sure if it was so we could see our beautiful food or if evening lights had not been dimmed yet. I will definitely be bringing anyone here who has not been before. Thank you!. Also, I had to leave in a hurry and asked for my bill while still eating. They brought the bill and  paid promptly. In todays lowered service quality this was nice to see good service again.

I love coming to saku. The cheese katsu is always my favourite but its a bit difficult for me to finish as the sets are huge! It comes with unlimited rice, miso, and salad. Their salad dressing is my absolute favourite! I drown my salad, knowing its prob bad, but its so good. I tried my friends katsu nabe and i wasnt a fan. Personally, i wasnt a fan of the crispy tonkatsu drowning in soup. It was obviously starting to get soggy when i tried it, and i ate a piece as soon as it arrived to the table, so it was as fresh and piping hot as could be. She enjoyed it but i wouldnt order. Order it if you like soup and dont mind soggy meat though.
A great meal with a very attentive staff. Let me know how to request extra items and served my meal super quickly. 1st of many visits to Saku for me!

The food here never disappoints! The Katsu even tastes great for takeout, but nothing beats eating it fresh. I love to share the Zenbu Katsu paired with the Kake Udon when eating here with my partner, because you get to have a little bit of everything without overindulging in deep fried goodness. Dont sleep on the shredded cabbage! It tastes amazing with their house dressing - I drown mine and always get thirds  . Make sure your whole party is there, or you wont get seated. They are also super nice with kids and have special cutlery, bowls, and plates for them! Kid-friendliness: Kid friendly serving materials

Delicious cutlet, entirely worth the wait. Despite the restaurant being very busy, the waitstaff was very attentive and courteous. The curry katsu was amazing, very flavourful curry sauce. And they provide free refills on the rice, salad and soup! Interior design of the place was also lovely.

Went here for the first time with some friends. We had to wait about 45 minutes to sit down it was that popular. I got the curry and it was fantastic. It was exactly like what I had in Japan if not better. Service was solid despite it being so busy. Only real negative is it is on the more expensive side.

The staff there are soft spoken and accommodating. It gets busy here so be prepared to get waitlisted and pre order when your seat is just about ready. Food is AHmazing.  Table favorite was from their specials menu: creamy lobster croquettes.  Personal fave was the scallop as it was cooked perfectly.

It s always my most favourite katsu in Vancouver! I recommend you to order The Zenbu Katsu, it s a full set for sharing to 2 people. It s combine with everything, pork, chicken, shrimp, veggies and cheese. For the side dish, it s all refill for cabbage, soup and rice. Services are excellent as well.

Saku has ruined me for pork cutlet. These were simply outstanding and Im not expecting to have a a katsu nearly as good anywhere else. The breading is so crispy & crunchy and the pork was tender and fatty and hot and juicy and oh so perfectly cooked. I normally do not eat very much food and when my tray arrived I thought that with all the side salad and miso soup and rice and all that I would have maybe 2 or 3 bites of katsu but I could not stop eating once I started and before I knew it I had finished the whole thing. I even did the thing where I had to loosen my belt. It was all too good to stop eating. Saku is the pork cutlet category killer for sure. Ive never had one that can compare.

I loved this place! Definitely one of the best tonkatsu place outside of Japan! We ordered the premium pork loin (premium rosu katsu) and the curry udon. The pork was so tender and juicy, it didnt feel overcooked at all! I wish there were more pieces given the price of $27. The curry tasted amazing, but the texture of the udon was mediocre - a bit too mushy for my taste, I prefer it more chewy. The best part is the unlimited salad, rice and miso soup. The miso soup or tonjiru is so flavourful, I had 3 bowls and still crave it. We poured the remaining curry sauce over the rice and it was another way to enjoy the meal. The salad was crisp and cold, really helped balance out the fried food. I also loved the pickles they served! We went on a Friday for lunch and didnt have to wait. However if you have a large party, expect some wait time.

Be sure to get here early or put your name on the yelp waitlist! This place has authentic katsu and other Japanese fare! The curry sauce was rich, and the tonkatsu was crispy on the outside and juicy inside!

We were able to get a table without waiting on a weekday night around 7pm which was great. I always get the cheese one and it hits the spot. My partner ordered the nabe one which was good too but I think nothing beats the cheese one. Portion was very filling and I barely needed to get any refills of the sides. Service was great and offered refills multiple times.

Always an positive experience here every time i visit. From when you enter the restaurant to the customer service and the food quality, never a disappointment. Highly recommend for anyone visiting downtown vancouver, i personally always bring my friends who are visiting to try this place out. Favourite item has to be the cheesy katsu!

Very cool place and the food is very delicious! Facilities are nice and clean with a  very cool hip vibe! The service was fantastic, absolutely no complaints. I definitely recommend stopping by for some food. It will not disappoint.
Love the katsu! Nothing else is comparable :) I highly recommend the cheese katsu and zenbu. Each visit the service is friendly with many refills. Food : 5/5

Outstanding 10/10. Happy to say my meal lived up to my expectations and the hype. Im a stickler for over paying for food, but even at $32 after tip I was stoked with my meal. I ordered the Hire katsu with a cheese katsu side addition. The katsu pork is soft while the crunch is perfect, the rice freshly steamed and the simple cabbage salad just brings it all together. Whatever that sesame dressing for the coleslaw is, is absolute fire. When you take a bite of katsu dipped in the sauce, then a big bite of rice and cabbage... that is a perfect flavour profile. Also the cheese katsu was delish, I could ravage a lot of that. After three times being denied as it was too busy I finally got in and Ill definitely be back. Thanks SAKU!

I dream about coming back here for tonkatsu. The whole experience was so magical. The restaurant is beautiful and bright, spacious but cozy, and decorated with warm wood throughout the space. The waiter was kind, respectful and detail oriented. The tray held your tonkatsu and an assortment of little condiments and side dishes. Each had its own role to constantly change up your eating experience and reinvigorate your taste buds to go in for another bite: juicy tender fatty pork with a crunchy exterior with a squeeze of citrus spark on top, thin crispy fresh cabbage, total body warming miso soup, a little salt to amplify your tastes, DIY freshly ground sesame seeds for a nutty, earthy tone mixed into the deep umami sauce vs the creamy and tart.. tartar sauce, pickles to cleanse your palate and cut the fat, and Japanese rice to bring everything harmoniously together. Not to mention the rice, cabbage and miso soup have unlimited refills? Ive never had tonkatsu like this before.
The best tonkatsu Ive had in North America. You would be doing yourself a disservice by not eating here. Edit: 4 years later, its still better than anything else Ive had, including in Hawaii

You already know that the Katsu here is awesome and I agree, but I want to also tell you about the Tanjiro that is the soup that you can get and is rich in flavour very neat at the beginning was like a miso soup with real flavour, latter my ignorance was clear. The Rice is very fluffy and nice cook it is very unique for be in Vancouver the sea salt and the sesame seed ( that was very funny to smash) is a superb topping for the meal. The ambiance is so relax and the staff very friendly

LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT SAKU!!!! I would highly recommend. In my reviews they mention how the rice, cabbage and miso soup is unlimited. You can opt out for udon for additional 4$ and you will still receive a serving of rice, which again is unlimited. For first time goers the servers are super nice and friendly, they will explain how to enjoy your meal. With the dressing being readily available at your table, it makes it easy to enjoy your meal. The atmosphere was very authentic to being in Japan. You have to wait outside the restaurant and there is a list to put your name. You are given the option to have a table to yourself or shared seating. Trust me when I say shared seating is not that bad, theres definitely enough space between you and the other party that its basically your own table! I loved how the dressing was at the table and theres the option between ponzo dressing and the sesame. I liked a mixture of both !! The katsu were super Crispy on the outside and moist (or super cheesy) on the inside. The pork was definitely still moist, which was great. The cheese katsu, I highly suggest that is super cheesy! Definitely had that cheese pull factor!!! Get an order of the Jumbo Prawn, you wont regret it. I also ordered a side of their curry, which was shared between two people and there was a lot left over! Meals average between 16-18$ and you can add additional katsu to try out ! I would highly recommend Saku to anyone. Prepare for a wait as the restaurant isnt that big. Its sooo good!!!!!!

This place in downtown Vancouver is a gem of a restaurant, the food was appealing and so was the overall presentation, the ambience and the service matched the quality all the way. Highly recommend visiting Saku if youre in Vancouver

Arguably the best katsu in town, if not in the entire metro. I often order the classic hire katsu but anything on the menu is delicious. Bright ambiance. Staff are super friendly. They are quite popular and can get quite busy so plan your visits. The wait is totally worth it.

Ordered their chicken thigh curry dish. Super filling and tasty! Its also nice that they do refills on rice, soup and salad. The only downside is the wait list, didnt know until we showed up that you could add yourself to wait list on yelp.

Love this spot for their Rosa katsu! Deep fried to perfection and comes in a gorgeous set meal. I love everything that comes with it - the delicious soup (unlimited refills), the salad (unlimited refills and the killer dressing), the extra salt and sesame, the amazing sauce. The meal is differently filling and oh so worth it! Service is also extremely prompt and attentive. Be sure to put yourself on the wait list via Yelp!
If you are a fan of deep fried pork chops! Very good! Unlimited miso soup, rice and salad to go with your choice of prepared pork chop

Decided to come here for a late lunch, but even then, the place is still packed. Very popular and I could see why. We got the Zenbu set and it was a lot of food for 2 people. It was so good though. Esp the fatty pork and scallop. Also have to mention the salad. Seems very simple but the dressing is amazing. Service was just fine but the atmosphere was really nice. Will come back for sure.
This place is a Vancouver treasure. Best katsu and Japanese curry in the city. I eat here everytime in Downtown. Very courteous and cheerful servers always make me happy. Go visit now!

Made me feel like I was in Japan again... But at slightly higher prices! The panko breading and deep frying is on point and very good. The big combo set that gives you a bunch of different fried options is really good, and good value as well. We supplemented it with an extra big shrimp and a bowl of curry. Id recommend the same! (We were two people.) You can request additional coleslaw, rice, and miso as needed. The side sauces are also very good, especially the one that comes with the fried shrimp. Make sure you put yourself on the waiting list BEFORE you get there so that you can minimize your waiting time!

The food here is amazing! You get a big portion of food so it is worth the price. However bear in mind it gets busy quick and you will need to place your name in the queue via yelp, and wait in line. When we were there unfortunately it took way longer than usual to get seated. Will definitely come back for more tonkatsu!

Quite honestly one of the best restaurants Ive ever been to. First of all, the process to wait in line before getting a table is so smooth. All you have to do is register yourself in a virtual lineup, and they will notify you when you should be outside of the restaurant as a table opens up so that allows you to browse the area while you wait. We got to explore a bit before we got in which was nice. When we got there, we were seated within minutes. The employees are so informative and always ready to help you out. And the FOOD. I got the chicken katsu and oh my goodness - this breading cannot be replicated. It was crispy without being overly greasy and salty. They offer sauces on the side to add flavour to the degree of your choosing, which I can appreciate as someone who doesnt particularly love food drenched in sauce. To top it off, you get such an elaborate tray of food for just under $20 CAD - thats pretty impressive.

Saku is my favourite restaurant in Vancouver. There. I said it. I ve been coming to their restaurants for years and I still love it to death. The customer service is always top notch. The restaurant design at the Robson location is to die for. It s beautiful and spacious, and the hand wash station is outside of the toilets. That is one of my biggest things I care about in a restaurant, believe it or not. More places need to do this. Food is always high quality and delicious. Juicy and crispy katsu that is served with unlimited rice, unlimited salad, unlimited miso soup. I love the options for what to pair my katsu with. Flakey salt, mustard, katsu sauces, the possibilities are endless. I m always walking away with either a container with food or an extremely full belly. I don t
Best Japanese katsu in Vancouver the food was amazing, eliminated refills on the salad and soup.

Absolutely loved the food here. The katsu was cooked perfectly and tasted delicious! Great service and the restaurant itself is very beautiful. Our server was very friendly and gave us a run down of the menu and along with recommendations as it was our first time.

I had a great experience at Saku. We arrived before opening so we didn t have to wait to be seated. The service is great, the staff is really nice and the food came pretty quickly. We wanted to try their udon but they didn t have any that day. We tried the cheese katsu and ebi curry, both were really good. However, there could be more meat in the cheese katsu. The salad dressing is so good too!
My favorite katsu ever in USA/ Vancouver. It s cheap and yummy. Fried shrimp and fried oysters are so good. Recommended dishes

2021 update Saku has moved to a bigger location on Robson St. It is well-designed, bright, incredible aisle space between tables, many more tables and even private booths for larger parties on one side. Their COVID protocol is excellent, but I wish they would switch to a QR code and Google docs for collecting person contact information so we dont even have to touch a shared ballpoint pen. The first time we arrived at the new location, we were turned away because their wait list was already full for the lunch period. The good news is, they are using Yelp Food app which allows patrons to sign up for the wait list online. So, dont join a line when you get there. There are no lines. Once you are on the waitlist, Saku will text you when the table is almost ready. And, their menu has also been extended to include non-katsu items. 2019 I found this while looking at all the restaurants along Robson Street on Google Map. There was a line up when we arrived, the wait was around 30 minutes. Well worth it! We ordered Hire Katsu (breaded pork fillet) and Veggie Katsu (breaded tofu with vegetables). While they were both excellent, I think I will switch to the Vegetable Katsu next time because of the soft tofu. Its amazing how they can bread the soft tofu! The food comes on a tray with miso soup, rice, raw cabbage, pickles, Katsu sauce, mortar and pestle for grinding sesame seeds for the sauce, and lemon sea salt which I really like. The server explained everything to use, what sauce to use, and said that refills for soup, rice and cabbage is unlimited. The salad dressing for the cabbage is very delicious. They come around to offer refill for your soup bowl, and also refill of cabbage . The servers are very polite and courteous   real Japanese hospitality. It was an excellent experience. We will definitely come here again!
Great Service!! Good Food!! Beatiful Plating and Presentation!! Great Value!! Big Portion!! Unlimited Salad, Soup & Rice!!

We ordered special rose katsu & cheese katsu. Their service, food, and atmosphere are all amazing. We arrived there around 11:45am, and waited around 20mins which was not bad. Definitely the taste is worth for waiting

Awesome spot for your katsu cravings. Pleasant spot with a nice atmosphere, friendly staff and delicious food. Had the katsu nabe and fried ebi. The katsu comes with egg, onions and mushrooms in their housemade sauce. The katsu was super well done with crunchy outer coating with a tender and juicy piece of pork. The egg was delicate and mixed well eith their house sauce. The fried ebi add on was great as well. Real jumbo prawns, very crunchy and tender prawn. The main sets come with unlimited rice, salad and miso soup. Their salad dressing is top notch, really like it with their salad. This place gets busy and no reservations but, they do have a line they follow on yelp. Consider getting in line on yelp if they are busy.

Do you love Katsu? How about variety of sauces, and unlimited soup, rice, and cabbage? I was honestly blown away by the food quality, service, and presentation of the meal. You will not go away hungry, you may not even be able to go for a dessert after (I couldnt, and I was not upset about that). Highly recommended. There are lots of good places on Robson, skip those to come to Saku

I asked for the vegetarian during lunch and it was delicious. They were also offering a 15% discount on the published rates. They keep refilling salad, rice and water. Super friendly staff. I will definitely return and next time I  will try the pork. Very nice contemporary decor as well.

Delicious food, with large portions and very kind and attentive staff! There was unlimited rice and salad refills, and the most amazing sesame sauce to use as a topping for everything! I came with a group of friends and after one taste we all used up 2 bottles of it on our food because it was so good, so it was nice that we also got unlimited refills of the sauce bottles too!

I recently dined at SAKU and I am thrilled with my experience. The food was amazing, service was fast and staff were polite & attentive. Zenbu Katsu and lobster croquette  were particularly outstanding. I will definitely be returning!
Saku has the best tonkatsu ever! I always get the zenbu katsu and its incredible! They always make my orders with great care and presentation. Super friendly staff and service.

It is a really nice place for katsu. I got the zenbu katsu since I wanted to try everything. Warning for people having a normal appetite. It is better to order it only if you have two people and so you can order an extra set of rice. It is just way too much for one person. The table next to mine also couldnt finish it. The breading was nice and just enough. It tastes amazing when it is hot and you can feel the crispiness. The pork and chicken were moist. I actually loved the chicken more than the pork but overall, everything were amazing. You can also refill rice, salad and miso soup for free. The staffs were nice and I loved the design of the restaurant. It does feel very authentic. The price may be relatively higher but I will say it worth every penny. PS. You can actually smell the Katsu when you walk pass the restaurant. It just smells amazing. And like all good things, there is always a queue, so better to join the waitlist on Yelp.
Make sure you join the waitlist if you re planning on going during peak hours!! The food was so good and the service was great

By far the nicest tonkatsu in BC. The right degree of crunch, tender pork, perfectly cooked rice, and delicious tonkotsu soup. They do one thing (well, a few varieties of one thing) really, really well. I feel like I m back in Japan whenever I m here. Note: not Halal or kosher.

Delicious and crispy tonkatsu! We ordered Zenbu katsu and regular tonkatsu with curry and it was super! Ingredients are fresh and full of flavor. My favorite was hire katsu and the shrimp katsu! Curry is MUST! Pro tips: reserve before you go!
Went with friends and had a great experience and found the food delicious.

Ive been a customer of Saku since they opened. The quality and service have always remained consistent. Portions are very generous. Fresh ingredients and awesome taste. Definitely one of the top Japanese restaurants in the city.

This is the golden standard for Japanese Tonkatsu. You can try katsu with just sauce on the side or bathed in Japanese curry. Both varieties are unique and the quality is amazing, everytime. I find this location to be better in terms of food as well as atmosphere, but their service is wonderful in all locations in the city. Definitely a must-try in the city!

It was one of the best restaurants I have ever been to! A well decorated place with pleasant atmosphere. The staff were nice and friendly. The food was amazing; delicious and served in large portions. It came with their fantastic traditional Japanese pickles and unlimited rice, salad, and soup. The only small complaint is that they didnt have a guest Wi-Fi. I am extremely satisfied with my experience here and will definitely visit again.

Got the zenbu (everything) plate and it was sooooo good. Definitely best bang for your buck. The food was delicious, the servers were super friendly, overall great experience! The croquettes were very good too

Saku moved here recently from their relatively small location just a little bit further down. This new location looks fabulous, its got big booths as well as adjustable tables, waiter area in the center where they can keep an eye out for anybody hailing them, and even a patio area (that they have yet to utilize). The food here has always been good but now the menu has expanded to include everything that they have on the Broadway location and then some. The same endless sides of miso, rice and shredded cabbage are still there. And the variations can go from a different cut of meat to different flavors entirely and as long as you know what ton katsu is you wont be disappointed. The staff are great theyre attentive ready to offer you a new bowl of miso or whatever else, take the right amount of time to ask if youre ready to order and dont go hide in the back of house. Probably one of the most assured good experience restaurants that I can go to.

Tip: Join the Yelp waitlist ahead of time. They dont take regular reservations but you can join the Yelp waitlist even remotely and then just check in when you get there. Yes, there is going to be a very long wait but the wait was totally worth it for us. Food: Saku had the best Katsu Ive ever had anywhere. The coating was light and the meat inside was cooked perfectly tender. The flavors were so great. They also give you unlimited Miso Soup and Cabbage Salad - I could not get enough of the salad and their salad dressing - definitely got at least 2 refills of that at our table. We also got at least once refill of the Miso Soup. Dont forget to take advantage of the refills! I really wanted to get their sampler but I ended up getting the premium pork. My friend got the one with the curry and they were very impressed with the curry. You can get an extra side of curry so you can have some extra dipping sauce! Highly recommend a meal here if you are in the area. Just plan to wait a long time but be rewarded at the end! *Oh they were super concerned about allergies and made sure my friend wasnt eating anything she couldnt. They pulled out a whole ingredient list to double check!* Great service!

What is not to like about this place? The katsu is fried to perfection. They serve a healthy portion of salad, miso and rice with all of those being bottomless so you can order more if you need. Not sure why I ordered the chicken over the signature pork but in the end I was super satisfied so why not?

One of my sons  favourite restaurant when in downtown. Expect waiting time up to 45 mins. Food is always fresh and you can request for additional rice and salad for free. Service is always good too. Will be back again and again.
